intro: Claoxylon helleri, commonly known as the Heller's claoxylon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palm-like appearance with elongated, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
